DataElement.preferredName: Montreal Cognitive Assessment Version 8.3 Language - Fluency Test Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The score of the Language - Fluency test.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Montreal Cognitive Assessment Functional Test Montreal Cognitive Assessment Language - Fluency Test
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale developed by Ziad Nasreddine in 1996 to screen for mild cognitive dysfunction and impairment. This instrument assesses the following cognitive domains: attention and concentration, executive functions, memory, language, visuoconstructional skills, conceptual thinking, calculations, and orientation._This task requires an individual to list all of the words from two sentences they can be recalled that begin with the letter "F".

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale developed by Ziad Nasreddine in 1996 to screen for mild cognitive dysfunction and impairment. This instrument assesses the following cognitive domains: attention and concentration, executive functions, memory, language, visuoconstructional skills, conceptual thinking, calculations, and orientation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
